segment.source: Manage mobile devices and computers, no servers or intranet required.
segment.target: Manage mobile devices and computers, no servers or intranet required.

segment.source: You can manage mobile devices and computers, even if those devices are not joined to a domain or brought on-site.
segment.target: You can manage mobile devices and computers, even if those devices are not joined to a domain or brought on-site.

segment.source: ideal for a company with a mobile or geographically-distributed workforce.
segment.target: ideal for a company with a mobile or geographically-distributed workforce.

segment.source: Require encryption of mobile devices and computers.
segment.target: Require encryption of mobile devices and computers.

segment.source: Mobile devices that support encryption can be required to use it.
segment.target: Mobile devices that support encryption can be required to use it.

segment.source: You can also require computers that support Bitlocker drive encryption to use it.
segment.target: You can also require computers that support Bitlocker drive encryption to use it.

segment.source: If a mobile device or computer with encryption is lost or stolen, the data on the device’s storage media is unreadable, helping to secure that data it from theft.
segment.target: If a mobile device or computer with encryption is lost or stolen, the data on the device’s storage media is unreadable, helping to secure that data it from theft.

segment.source: Generate hardware and software inventories and reports.
segment.target: Generate hardware and software inventories and reports.

segment.source: You can gather information on the hardware and software used by your company, helping you to plan your hardware upgrade cycle or determine if unwanted software is installed on managed devices.
segment.target: You can gather information on the hardware and software used by your company, helping you to plan your hardware upgrade cycle or determine if unwanted software is installed on managed devices.

segment.source: You can create alerts to notify you when there is a problem with a mobile device or a computer, and also have alerts trigger e-mail notifications so that the right people are informed of the problem.
segment.target: You can create alerts to notify you when there is a problem with a mobile device or a computer, and also have alerts trigger e-mail notifications so that the right people are informed of the problem.

segment.source: Users can use the company portal to enroll devices, to install site-licensed software, or to find contact information for IT administrators.
segment.target: Users can use the company portal to enroll devices, to install site-licensed software, or to find contact information for IT administrators.

segment.source: You use two types of administrator accounts, user accounts with additional permissions, and two separate administration consoles to grant your admins access to the things they should manage.
segment.target: You use two types of administrator accounts, user accounts with additional permissions, and two separate administration consoles to grant your admins access to the things they should manage.

segment.target: The following sections explain these accounts and portals.

segment.target: Intune administrator accounts and special permissions

segment.source: Tenant administrators are assigned one administrator role, which defines the administrative scope for that user and the tasks they can manage.
segment.target: Tenant administrators are assigned one administrator role, which defines the administrative scope for that user and the tasks they can manage.

segment.source: Administrator roles are common between the different Microsoft cloud services although some services might not support some roles.
segment.target: Administrator roles are common between the different Microsoft cloud services although some services might not support some roles.

segment.source: Integration with other Microsoft cloud services
segment.target: Integration with other Microsoft cloud services

segment.source: shares a common foundation with other Microsoft cloud services.
segment.target: shares a common foundation with other Microsoft cloud services.

segment.source: When you use the same account to subscribe to multiple cloud services, those services use the same Microsoft Azure AD infrastructure, and they are tenants of Azure AD.
segment.target: When you use the same account to subscribe to multiple cloud services, those services use the same Microsoft Azure AD infrastructure, and they are tenants of Azure AD.

segment.source: Azure AD provides the core directory and identity management capabilities for Microsoft cloud services.
segment.target: Azure AD provides the core directory and identity management capabilities for Microsoft cloud services.

segment.source: as a stand-alone cloud service or as a cloud service that is integrated with other products.
segment.target: as a stand-alone cloud service or as a cloud service that is integrated with other products.

segment.source: You can use one or more of the following methods to reduce network bandwidth use for
segment.target: You can use one or more of the following methods to reduce network bandwidth use for

segment.source: Use a proxy server to cache content requests
segment.target: Use a proxy server to cache content requests

segment.source: You can use a proxy server that can cache content to reduce duplicate downloads and reduce the use of network bandwidth by clients that request content from the Internet.
segment.target: You can use a proxy server that can cache content to reduce duplicate downloads and reduce the use of network bandwidth by clients that request content from the Internet.

segment.source: A caching proxy server receives requests for content from client computers on your network, retrieves that content from the Internet, and can then cache both HTTP responses and binary downloads.
segment.target: A caching proxy server receives requests for content from client computers on your network, retrieves that content from the Internet, and can then cache both HTTP responses and binary downloads.

segment.source: The server uses the cached information to answer subsequent requests from
segment.target: The server uses the cached information to answer subsequent requests from

segment.source: The following are typical settings to use for a proxy server that caches content for
segment.target: The following are typical settings to use for a proxy server that caches content for

segment.source: The value varies based on the number of client computers in your network and the configurations you use.
segment.target: The value varies based on the number of client computers in your network and the configurations you use.

segment.source: To prevent files from being deleted too soon, adjust the size of the cache for your environment.
segment.target: To prevent files from being deleted too soon, adjust the size of the cache for your environment.

segment.source: This setting might not be available in all caching proxy servers.
segment.target: This setting might not be available in all caching proxy servers.

segment.target: packages are CAB files retrieved by Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) download over HTTP.

segment.target: For information about using a proxy server to cache content, see the documentation for your proxy server solution.

segment.source: After you complete the sign-up process, you cannot change that domain name.
segment.target: After you complete the sign-up process, you cannot change that domain name.

segment.source: However, as a global administrator, you can add your own custom domain names for your organization to use with the service, or you can remove domains that you’ve added previously.
segment.target: However, as a global administrator, you can add your own custom domain names for your organization to use with the service, or you can remove domains that you’ve added previously.

segment.source: If you want to use a domain name that you own rather than the one that you were given at signup, you can add the domain name to Azure AD.
segment.target: If you want to use a domain name that you own rather than the one that you were given at signup, you can add the domain name to Azure AD.

segment.source: After you add the domain, and it has been verified that you own it, you can create accounts and groups that include the domain name by changing DNS resource records at your DNS hosting provider.
segment.target: After you add the domain, and it has been verified that you own it, you can create accounts and groups that include the domain name by changing DNS resource records at your DNS hosting provider.
